entry.value: proDA analysis node, based on proDA R package, allows the identification of diferentially expressed proteins in the label-free mass spectrometry data. %%00010%%00010Unlike other methods, proDA does not impute missing values, which are very common in proteomic experiments; instead constructs a probabilistic dropout model.%%00010For more information, please refer to https://github.com/const-ae/proDA or original paper Constantin Ahlmann-Eltze and Simon Anders: proDA: Probabilistic Dropout Analysis for Identifying Differentially Abundant Proteins in Label-Free Mass Spectrometry. biorXiv 661496 (Jun 2019).%%00010%%00010For the input, log2 transformed and normalized intensities are required. User should further provide:%%00010- experimental design (i.e. define particular samples/conditions)%%00010- replicates design%%00010- contrasts (samples which will be compared, separated by comma).%%00010%%00010As for the ouput, user is provided with the results of Wald statistical test: %%00010- pval: the p-value of the statistical test%%00010- adj_pval: the multiple testing adjusted p-value%%00010- diff: the difference that particular coefficient makes. In differential expression analysis this value is also called log fold change, which is equivalent to the difference on the log scale.%%00010- t_statistic: the diff divided by the standard error se%%00010- se: the standard error associated with the diff%%00010- df: the degrees of freedom, which describe the amount of available information for estimating the se. They are the sum of the number of samples the protein was observed in, the amount of information contained in the missing values, and the degrees of freedom of the variance prior.%%00010- avg_abundance: the estimate of the average abundance of the protein across all samples.%%00010- n_approx: the approximated information available for estimating the protein features, expressed as multiple of the information contained in one observed value.%%00010- n_obs: the number of samples a protein was observed in%%00010(for further details please follow the test_diff function documentation https://rdrr.io/github/const-ae/proDA/man/test_diff.html)%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010Python 3 (The Python consists of the following Python 3.6 License. Licence terms are available here: https://docs.python.org/3.6/license.html)%%00010R (The R consists of the following GNU General Public Licences. Licence terms are available here: https://www.r-project.org/Licenses/)%%00010R package proDA (The proDA consists of the following GPL-3 license. Licence terms are available here: https://www.r-project.org/Licenses/GPL-3)%%00010%%00010The metanode was created in KNIME 3.7.2 running inside the docker image (https://hub.docker.com/r/cfprot/knime/), tag 3.7.2a.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010This version of metanode is available under the GNU GPL 3.0 License, unless stated otherwise. The full version of the license terms is available at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.%%00010Version: 1.0.1 from 2019-08-27%%00010Contact person: Kristina Gomoryova (423436@mail.muni.cz)%%00010More information can be found at https://github.com/OmicsWorkflows/KNIME_metanodes.
input table containing data columns to be compared
Outer workflow does not have input data, execute it first
